did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.repository: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center.
did.abstract: The papers of George Shea include some of his unpublished poetry, correspondence and research on George A. Custer.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: George Shea was born in 1932, studied at the University of Connecticut and served in the Presidential Honor Guard at Arlington National Cemetery. Mr. Shea has written and published poetry and historical research on George A. Custer and the 1876 battle at Little Big Horn. Mr. Shea resides in Wethersfield, CT.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains poems, notes, publications and one videocassette pertaining to Mr. Shea's interests. Also included is a plaque with a poem written in honor of Cindy M. Beaudoin, a UConn alumnae who died while serving in Desert Storm.
